settings.question: What is the status of my rewards order?
settings.answer: you will receive an email with tracking information once your rewards order has been processed and shipped. please allow up to 7-10 business days for your order to ship. contact info@loveamikapro.com with further inquiries.

settings.question: What's taking my order so long to get here?
settings.answer: We ship exclusively with FedEx, with the fastest delivery method available for each order -- due to the current pandemic, FedEx is processing an exceptionally high volume of parcels for the entire United States. Based on estimates we've been given from FedEx, please allow up to an additional week for your order to be processed and delivered by FedEx. During this time, FedEx tracking may not update daily, and may show a "Pending" delivery status. Just like us, FedEx is doing everything they can to get your order to you ASAP!

settings.question: What are my shipping options?
settings.answer: amika pro orders ship via FedEx/USPS on business days (Monday through Friday from 8:30am-5:30pm EST, excluding major holidays). amika pro offers free standard shipping on orders $70 or more to the contiguous 48 U.S. states on all orders. Orders that are below $70 will be charged a $10 flat shipping rate. We currently do not ship to P.O. boxes, APO, FPO, DPO destinations and freight forwarding addresses. We do not ship to Canada and Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Guam, U.S. Virgin Islands and all other U.S. territories at this time. For questions, please contact us at info@loveamikapro.com.

settings.question: Can I cancel my order?
settings.answer: Most orders placed before 4pm EST will ship the same day. Should you need to cancel your order, we will do our best to accommodate if we receive an email from you within 2 hours of placing the order at info@loveamikapro.com. Please be sure to include your order number in the subject line. Once we cancel your order, we will refund the initial purchase.

settings.question: How do I return an item?
settings.answer: We do not offer returns on purchases on loveamikapro.com through your rewards gift cards. If you receive a defective item, please reach out to us at info@loveamikapro.com

settings.question: How can I reach the customer service team and when should I expect a response?
settings.answer: Please contact Customer Service at info@loveamikapro.com. Our team is available Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. EST. We do our best to respond to all customers within 48 hours.

settings.question: Is there a limit to the number of products I can purchase?
settings.answer: All items have a maximum of 3 quantity limit placed that may be purchased in one transaction.

settings.question: How do I find out about upcoming launches and restocks?
settings.answer:
For restocks, visit the product page and enter your email address in the coming soon field. You will receive an email once that item is back in stock.

For new launches, sign up for our newsletter and we'll send you the latest news!

settings.question: Do rewards expire?
settings.answer: yes, e-gift cards expire 60 days after they are issued

settings.question: I received a defective item in my rewards order.
settings.answer:
email us at info@loveamikapro.com including the following details:

order #

product & size

defect details

batch number (normally found on bottom of bottle or tag of appliance)

photo/video showing us what’s wrong

Once we verify the loyalty program purchase under your account, we'll be in touch with next steps. Defective item replacements will be honored within 90 days of original order placement

settings.question: I can’t log in to my account – help!
settings.answer: please reset your password by selecting the"forgot password" link on the account page. we'll send an email to the address on file that will prompt you to reset your password, then sign in as usual! if you're still having issues, please contact us at info@loveamikapro.com

settings.question: Can I order all my amika direct?
settings.answer: no, the custom salon rewards portal does not allow cash payments of more than $10. regular product orders must go through your professional distributor.

settings.question: I am an independent stylist and I purchase more than $500 per month. Can I receive monthly rewards?
settings.answer: absolutely! please communicate to your salon consultant that you would prefer to be recognized as a salon for monthly rewards. if you participate in the monthly program, however, you are not able to revert to quarterly should you miss the monthly qualification minimums.

settings.question: Do my purchases with another distributor count?
settings.answer: this is a limited-time, exclusive pilot program available only to salons serviced by goldwell of ny. purchases through any other distributor will not count.

settings.main-text:
hey there, we’re amika
a friend to hair, hairstylists, to her, him, you & them
settings.ban-text1:
The name amika means
friend in the language Esperanto
& is a symbol of our belief in the
power of community and the beauty of diversity.
settings.ban-text2: Straight out of Brooklyn, where creativity and culture are a way of life. We’re a collective of creatives, hairstylists, chemists, and product junkies that like to bend the rules. This leads to some pretty radical thinking from our packaging, to our company values, and the products we make. The result is a culture of inclusion, positivity and fun.
settings.zigZ-para1:
all hair is welcome

10 collections for every hair concern–no matter ethnicity, age or gender
settings.zigZ-para2:
always cruelty-free

we have never & will never conduct animal testing
settings.zigZ-para3:
going greener

reducing waste + switching bottles to 90% PCR
settings.zigZ-para5:
friend to all

we’re here for you, every one of you beautiful beings
settings.img3-head: we were kind & clean before it was a thing
settings.blu-cont:
We hunted down one of the most potent natural ingredients on the planet, Sea Buckthorn Berry. This "SUPERFRUIT" is one of the few plant sources of the fatty-acid Omega 7 (responsible for increasing synthesis of elastin and collagen) making it the ultimate holy grail ingredient for hair and scalp.

We added a scent you can’t forget, and well the rest is history.
settings.slide-BGcont:
We only make products that make us proud.
Highly effective haircare that have always been cruelty-free, formulated without sulfates, parabens, aluminum starch and over 1,300 questionable ingredients banned by the European Union.

settings.prod_caption: the wizard, perk up, soulfood, un.done

settings.text: amika is an independent professional line of haircare products and tools from Brooklyn, New York.
settings.text1: Our products are like a good friend - dependable, straightforward, and fun to spend time with. They do exactly what they say while being carefully organized by collection, which makes them simple to learn and use - for both stylists and clients.
settings.slide-caption: Our eye-catching packaging and signature fragrance drive interest and create loyal fans that want to explore the line and experiment further. We offer unrivaled start-up packages and creative monthly promotions. Our salon merchandising materials are designed to help you reach retail nirvana. We love to develop new lifestyle items, affectionately called SWAG, that are as fun as our products.
settings.friend-text1: We welcome you to join our quarterly salon loyalty program friends with benefits for access to additional support and amika education. Want even more support? amika jewel salons earn 23% return on purchases plus regular access to amika artistry styling classes.
settings.dress-text1: Styling is our passion and we have a nationwide team of educators ready to teach foundational + avantgarde styling techniques. We offer both trial and broader introductory salon packages. We partner with select professional distributors across North America and the globe to make our products and programs available through stores and salon consultants. Not sure who your local distributor is? Fill out the form below. We look forward to hearing from you.
settings.form-text1:
Become an educator
Become a (network/styleblow) salon DNYFW

settings.question: What is HairToStay?
settings.answer:
HairToStay is a nonprofit organization committed to raising awareness and financial aid for scalp cooling technology, a treatment which can prevent hair loss during chemotherapy. Currently, this treatment is inaccessible for many people, as scalp cooling is not covered by most insurance providers.

HairToStay has raised over $2.5 million since its inception and has awarded subsidies of $1,000 to $1,500 to over 1,600 patients nationwide. 

The organization is dedicated to increasing access to scalp cooling for patients who have a financial need and educating patients, the public, and hair professionals about the benefits of scalp cooling.

Though used throughout Europe and across the globe for close to two decades, this technology was largely unavailable and unknown in the US, until the FDA Clearance in December 2015.

settings.question: What is scalp cooling?
settings.answer:
By cooling the scalp during chemotherapy, hair loss can be prevented by impacting two cellular processes. Scalp cooling constricts the blood vessels in the hair follicles, thereby exposing them to less of the chemotherapy medication that often results in total hair loss.

Additionally, the chemotherapy’s effects on the hair follicle are reduced due to the slowing of the cellular metabolism. By inhibiting hair loss, scalp cooling technology works to maintain a sense of normalcy and privacy in a patient’s life, and can thwart the emotional damage that hair loss can often cause.

settings.question: Why is amika partnering with HairToStay?
settings.answer:
amika has always been much more than just a professional hair care and tools company. We not only understand the impact that our products have on women's life, helping them look and feel their best, we have also always understood the importance of giving back. As a company that is involved in helping the community, we found HairToStay to be an amazing opportunity to make meaningful impacts and help women going through chemotherapy. In partnering with HairToStay, we will help spread awareness and finance scalp cooling treatment for cancer patient’s, which prevents hair loss during chemotherapy.

“amika is uniquely positioned to support HairToStay, as our community of hairdressers intimately understand how important hair is to your sense of confidence and self-expression. We believe in the power of feeling beautiful and true to yourself—and want to work to ensure that those undergoing chemotherapy can look and feel like the best version of themselves possible.”

-Chelsea Riggs, amika Brand President

settings.question: How will amika support HairToStay?
settings.answer: 1% of all sales from the amika website will be donated to HairToStay.

settings.question: Want to help?
settings.answer: You have the power to raise awareness of scalp cooling while you shop. At checkout, you have the option to choose between $1 - $10 donation to HairToStay to be added to your order.

settings.question: I’m a salon owner/stylist. What can I do?
settings.answer:
Amika affiliate salon owners and stylists can host HairToStay Salon-a-thons. These are fundraising campaigns designed specifically for the haircare industry. You can help to raise the money needed to help women and men undergoing chemotherapy.

Salon-a-thons are unique to each salon, it’s up to the host to decide how much of the proceeds to donate. For more information on hosting a Salon-a-thon click here


We encourage you to donate at checkout to help us support this amazing organization. To learn more, please also visit HairToStay.org

settings.faq_content_heading: what do amika classes focus on?
settings.faq_content_paragraph: Amika artistry is dedicated to the craft of hairdressing. We aim to be the styling authority. Our classes are all technique-based and teach a range of styling and braiding techniques. We offer updo, bridal, blowout, and braiding classes. When in person, all classes are 3 hours and can be taught as hands-on, hands-in or demo-only. Digital education from amika is available in our Digital Academy and on @amikapro on Instagram.

settings.faq_content_heading: where can i find an amika class?
settings.faq_content_paragraph: Amika classes are offered globally through out distributor partners. To find a class near you, click the “IRL” link above. If you don’t see one close to you, you can email pro-education@loveamika.com to find out more.
Amika classes vary in price based on the length of the class, whether it is hands-on, hands-in or demo only. Check out the individual classes above by clicking the “IRL” link.

settings.faq_content_heading: what if i am interested in having an amika class in my salon?
settings.faq_content_paragraph: Contact your distributor (whoever you purchase amika from) and they will have information on how to get a class set up for you. Our in-salon classes are $500 one class or $800 for two classes in one day. If you have further questions, please email pro-education@loveamika.com.

settings.faq_content_heading: what is the difference between being an amika pro educator and being an amika brand ambassador?
settings.faq_content_paragraph:
An amika pro educator is a licensed hair stylist who eats, sleeps, and breaths the artistry of hair styling. Our team consists of all different types of stylists, including salon owners, booth renters, freelancers, bridal & session stylists, and much more. If styling is your jam and you are looking to challenge yourself to learn the amika approach, this team is for you!

An amika Brand Ambassador can be a licensed or non-licensed, self-proclaimed beauty product enthusiast who loves to spread the good word of amika to others. In this role, you will attend distributor sales meetings, represent amika in salons and retail stores, and teach product knowledge classes. If you are obsessed with educating yourself and others all about amika hair care and tools, then this is the team for you!

settings.faq_content_heading: If I am interested in being an amika pro educator or brand ambassador, where can I find out more?
settings.faq_content_paragraph:
We hire brand ambassadors and amika pro educators on a rolling basis globally. The best way to find out more is to email pro-education@loveamika.com.

*We are not currently hiring to join our Pro-education or Brand Ambassador teams due to the lack of in-person education as a result of COVID-19. However, you may still submit an email inquiry and we will review it and contact you back as soon as we can. Your email should include your Instagram handle as well as your City, State so we can determine your technical abilities as well as the demand for an educator in your area.

settings.eduactional_text:
amika brings edge, authority and dedication to the art of hair dressing. Our full-
spectrum curriculum covers everything from advanced finishing and foundations –
to braids, updos and waves. We take an unconventional approach to education,
demystifying complex looks and showing you essential styling-hacks, letting you
take your work to the next level.

amika artists will teach you a range of techniques that can be utilized for styling
behind the chair or on-set. Hair is more than cut and color, so we’re here to help
you up your styling game. Perfectionists welcome. This is amika: artistry.

settings.question: Who is TerraCycle®?
settings.answer: TerraCycle® specializes in recycling the un-recyclable. Well, what does that mean? Ever look at a product and think, can this be recycled…? Well TerraCycle removes that worry and fully recycles your product into something new. They collect, store, and recycle everything from our shampoo bottles to our spray pumps.

settings.question: Are amika products recyclable?
settings.answer:
Technically yes, they are, but local recyclers sometimes don’t have the ability to recycle our packaging. Things like pumps and tubes are not always taken by recycling facilities, which is why amika is partnering with TerraCycle to ensure that they are.

Partnering with TerraCycle allows for ALL amika packaging to be 100% recyclable, so you’ll never have to worry about your product going to the landfill. With TerraCycle we can guarantee it’s getting a second life.

settings.question: How does this work?
settings.answer:
Consumers (that’s you guys) finish your products, please make sure they’re empty, and print a free prepaid shipping label off our TerraCycle page. Attach the label to any parcel you have around (or repurpose the one that we use to ship your product to you) and ship back your empty products & closures.

TerraCycle receives the packaging and they hold onto it for us. Once we collect a significant amount it’s 100% recycled and given a new purpose. What’s its new purpose? (really anything amika can think of that’s made out of plastic!)

settings.customer_review: I think you are so kind and knew exactly what I need! I appreciate the help and I will surely recommend it do my friends and family! You are awesome
I'm actually a stylist and I LOVE how thorough the questions are!
This feature is extremely helpful!!! 10/10 would recommend

settings.heading: treat yourself
settings.paragraph:
earn loyalty reward points
for recycling
Read more

settings.first_section_paragraph:
80% of the 35 million tons of plastic the
US produces each year ends up in landfills
or oceans. to reduce amika's virgin plastic
production, we've partnered with TerraCycle
to create a free recycling program for
all our packaging
settings.second_section_paragraph: recycle from home by joining the program - save your packaging, download a free shipping label, and send in your empties or search the map for a local recycling solution
settings.third_section_paragraph: TerraCycle is a social enterprise dedicated to eliminating the idea of waste that specializes in recycling the un-recyclable. Ever look at a product and think, can this be recycled…? Well TerraCycle removes that worry and recycles your empties into something new. They collect, store, and recycle everything from our shampoo bottles to our spray pumps.
settings.fifth_section_text:
Are amika products recyclable?

Technically yes, but local recyclers sometimes don’t have the ability to recycle all of our packaging. Things like pumps and tubes are not always taken by recycling facilities, which is why amika is partnering with TerraCycle to ensure none of our packaging ends up in a landfull or the ocean.


How to recycle amika products?

Once you finish your products (please make sure they’re completely empty), print a free prepaid shipping label off our TerraCycle page. Attach the label to any parcel you have around and ship back your empty packaging.

TerraCycle receives the packaging and holds onto it to for us. Once we collect a significant amount, it’s 100% recycled and given a new purpose. What’s its new purpose? Anything amika can think of that’s made out of plastic!


What can I recycle?

Any packaging not in aerosol form (unfortunately no hair sprays or dry shampoo at this time).
